Communication Classes

Home > Communication

Public Speaking

Item Number
CMST& 220
Credits
5

An Open Course Library class with inexpensive course materials. Assists students in developing real-world oral communication skills. Capture the dynamics of todayâ€™s business realities and see the benefits of effective communication. Selection of topics, library research, analysis, oral style, use of visual aids, and preparation and delivery of various types of speeches and oral presentations are included. The Internet, email, community interaction, and other practical tools support student learning and increase public speaking skills. Emphasis is placed on principles of cultural diversity.

 

Prerequisites

Appropriate COMPASS (81 in reading)/SLEP placement score or successful completion of ENG 094.
